title: Predictions For 2016
summary:
Key ideas:
- The author makes a series of predictions for world events, politics, and personal/community matters for the year 2016
- The predictions include the likelihood of a major war involving the US, the future of ISIS, the outcome of the US presidential election, and personal goals of the author

Key learnings:
- The predictions made by the author are based on probability and have varying levels of confidence attached
- Predictions can be made for individual events as well as personal goals

Key questions:
- What are the risks and benefits of making predictions with probabilities attached?
- How can personal goals be incorporated into yearly predictions?
- What are some potential biases that may influence yearly predictions?
